content.body:
> <@shuyuguo:matrix.org> fwiw i still think "does TC39 care about long-term unforking of vastly popular JS forks" is a pretty important problem for the ecosystem

this is the only reasonable goal for me that might push this proposal forward, to unfork the fork

but that also skeptical. Remember CoffeeJS? If TypeScript no longer popular like CoffeeJS used to?

content.body: coffeescript, is maybe what you're thinking of? but that wasn't really a fork, it was just a different language which compiled to JS
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: coffeescript, is maybe what you're thinking of? but that wasn't really a fork, it was just a different language which compiled to JS

content.body: coffeescript did _fork_ the community though. es2015 brought a lot of folk back to js
content.formatted_body: coffeescript did fork the community though. es2015 brought a lot of folk back to js

content.body: Iâ€™m not sure if cs directly motivated any of the design of es2015. Maybe those who were involved will recall?

Maybe the same happened with Java? Have recent versions been motivated by peopleâ€™s adoption of Kotlin (Kotlin feels more like Java++ compared to other jvm languages like Scalar/Clojure that feel like entirely separate languages)

> <@jackworks:matrix.org> That's right, so I think we should make friendly advice them to add. If they are added, we can be free from adding a bench of syntax that doesn't do anything

_friendly advice_ is still not a requirement for stage advancement, no?
